intro: Chamaesyce yayalesia, commonly known as the yellowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
